Typealiases.html#/s:10APIManager4JSON.name: JSON
Typealiases.html#/s:10APIManager4JSON.abstract: JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a lightweight data-interchange format. Designed to be easy for humans to read and write and easy for machines to parse and generate.

Typealiases.html#/s:10APIManager11HTTPHe.name: HTTPHeaders
Typealiases.html#/s:10APIManager11HTTPHe.abstract: HTTPHeaders are components of the header section of request and response messages in the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP). They define the operating parameters of an APIRequest.

Typealiases.html#/s:10APIManager14HTTPPa.name: HTTPParameters
Typealiases.html#/s:10APIManager14HTTPPa.abstract: HTTPParameters are set of querys used to access specific data via an APIRequest. These parameters will be postpended to a url in form ?key1=value1&key2=value... etc.

Protocols/APIService.html#/s:ZvP10APIMan.name: headers
Protocols/APIService.html#/s:ZvP10APIMan.abstract: The HTTPHeaders to be sent alongside the APIRequests made by the endpoints in this APIService.

Protocols/APIAuthorization.html.name: APIAuthorization
Protocols/APIAuthorization.html.abstract: APIAuthorization defines all the properties and methods a class must contain to be used as an authorization for an APIRequest.

Protocols/APIService.html.name: APIService
Protocols/APIService.html.abstract: APIService defines all the properties and methods a class must contain to be used as a service in an APIRequest.

Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.name: GET
Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.abstract: The GET method requests a representation of the specified resource. Requests using GET should only retrieve data.

Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.name: HEAD
Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.abstract: The HEAD method asks for a response identical to that of a GET request, but without the response body.

Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.name: POST
Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.abstract: The POST method is used to submit an entity to the specified resource, often causing a change in state or side effects on the server.

Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.name: PUT
Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.abstract: The PUT method replaces all current representations of the target resource with the request payload.

Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.name: DELETE
Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.abstract: The DELETE method deletes the specified resource.

Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.name: OPTIONS
Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.abstract: The OPTIONS method is used to describe the communication options for the target resource.

Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.name: PATCH
Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html#/s:FO.abstract: The PATCH method is used to apply partial modifications to a resource.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:C10APIManager.name: Failure
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:C10APIManager.abstract: Alias for the callback when a APIRequest fails, called with the error description.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:C10APIManager.name: Success
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:C10APIManager.abstract: Alias for the callback when an APIRequest succeeds, called with the json response.

Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html.name: HTTPMethod
Classes/APIRequest/HTTPMethod.html.abstract: Enumeration of the HTTP methods supported by APIRequest.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:vC10APIManage.name: endpoint
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:vC10APIManage.abstract: The endpoint for the HTTP Request relative to the baseURL of the Service.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:vC10APIManage.name: params
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:vC10APIManage.abstract: The url parameters for the HTTP Request.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:vC10APIManage.name: body
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:vC10APIManage.abstract: The json body for the HTTP Request.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:vC10APIManage.name: success
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:vC10APIManage.abstract: The callback on a successful APIRequest, called with the json response.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:vC10APIManage.name: failure
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:vC10APIManage.abstract: The callback on a failed APIRequest, called with the error description.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:FC10APIManage.name: urlRequest(withAuthorization:)
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:FC10APIManage.abstract: Converts the APIRequest to a URLRequest to be used in a URLSession.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:FC10APIManage.name: onSuccess(_:)
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:FC10APIManage.abstract: Sets the callback on a successful APIRequest, called with the json response.

Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:FC10APIManage.name: onFailure(_:)
Classes/APIRequest.html#/s:FC10APIManage.abstract: Sets the callback on a failed APIRequest, called with the json response.

Classes.html.abstract: The following classes are available globally.
